medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe hypertension and loss of vision in the left eye.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was diagnosed with pseudoprecocious puberty at 20 months old, with fluctuating hypertension since childhood. By 42 years of age, the patient experienced a sudden loss of vision in the left eye related to central retinal vein occlusion, accompanied by chronic hypertension of around 180 mmHg, worsening over the years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a diagnosis of congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to 11b-hydroxylase deficiency and history of uncontrolled hypertension, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, and complications from glucocorticoid-suppressive therapy.
medical_history.family_history: The patient had a brother who exhibited signs of precocious puberty and died at 6.5 years of age, likely due to brain hemorrhage.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was a heavy smoker and previously demonstrated poor compliance with treatment, abandoning glucocorticoid therapy for 18 years.
